title: Comment on Mel Kiper names Towles one of his top underclassmen QBs by MattInTN
text:
Posted in Football , Main | 56 Responses 
Mel Kiper Jr. and his hair updated the top five underclassmen quarterbacks in college football yesterday and Kentucky’s own Patrick Towles made the list. 
Towles ranks fifth among underclassmen , according to Kiper, behind Jared Goff (California), Christian Hackenberg (Penn State), Cardale Jones (Ohio State), and Gunner Kiel (Cincinnati), respectively. 
Yet some of you still want him benched. 
Smdreads. Article written by Drew Franklin I can recite every line from Forrest Gump, blindfolded. Follow me on Twitter: @DrewFranklinKSR 56 responses to “Mel Kiper names Towles one of his top underclassmen QBs” October 8, 2015 at 11:04 am | Permalink | Reply 
Towles is a RS Junior gobgblu37 October 8, 2015 at 11:41 am | Permalink 
So what’s your point, juniors are considered underclassmen. October 8, 2015 at 11:46 am | Permalink 
juniors are considered upperclassmen … if you don’t know, just look it up 
I don’t think Towles should be benched, but Barker should be getting some reps, he has zero experience and he’s the backup gobgblu37 October 8, 2015 at 11:49 am | Permalink 
Obviously not when it comes to the NFL draft. CJ October 8, 2015 at 11:56 am | Permalink 
So you think that our backup QB, who has never taken a snap, should be getting reps when every one of our games has been close and came down to a TD or less? You’d make a great football coach with that philosophy. fatbrat October 8, 2015 at 11:57 am | Permalink 
According to the NFL any non-senior is considered an underclassman! As far as the ESPN experts… I know that their high school evaluation team is the lesser of all the groups. Kat 308 October 8, 2015 at 12:02 pm | Permalink 
Shut up Chad @BallBlog_Chad October 8, 2015 at 12:05 pm | Permalink 
leave it up to the coaches to decide exactly when to get him in for some reps, but I would have liked to have seen some already … Pinkel put his backup in during our game while it was close, do you think he’s a bad coach? his starter ended up getting suspended and the backup had to start, would you rather choose when your backup gets his first series or have it chosen for you? gobgblu37 October 8, 2015 at 12:20 pm | Permalink 
I also like how Mizzou has handled their qb situation. Pick a series when the qb will play and do it no matter what the score is. Thisiswong October 8, 2015 at 6:45 pm | Permalink 
You are right. and this “Screenshot” Drew took is from June. inside info2 October 8, 2015 at 11:07 am | Permalink | Reply 
Towles is not the 5th best underclassmen QB. This is just lazy writing on Kiper’s part. Towles looks like an NFL QB, but has none of the skills. Actually, it probably isn’t lazy writing on Kiper’s part. He is a TERRIBLE judge of NFL talent based on his mock drafts. 
Towles is no Woodson. And Woodson couldn’t even make it in the NFL. That’s not a disparaging remark towards Andre. Not many QBs CAN make it in the NFL. gobgblu37 October 8, 2015 at 11:46 am | Permalink 
ESPN considers him to be a fair judge of talent. I don’t think they pay him to guess on recruits! What makes your option on his options valid? Ha! October 8, 2015 at 12:17 pm | Permalink 
inside info2 needs to replace Mel Kiper on ESPN…. CapitalBlue October 8, 2015 at 1:19 pm | Permalink 
Who are your 5? Because just stating that “Towles is not the 5th best underclassmen [sic] QB” is, of course, just lazy writing on your part. Who October 8, 2015 at 11:14 am | Permalink | Reply 
Who listens to Mel Kiper? Matt October 8, 2015 at 11:21 am | Permalink | Reply 
Isnt Towels a Junior ? October 8, 2015 at 11:44 am | Permalink 
Underclassmen for College/NFL Football = non-seniors October 8, 2015 at 1:22 pm | Permalink 
*Towles October 8, 2015 at 11:29 am | Permalink | Reply 
I ASSUME YOU ARE SAYING KIPER IS THE ULTIMATE AUTHORITY ON TALENTED PLAYERS, HUH? DUH Poppschmidty October 8, 2015 at 11:32 am | Permalink | Reply 
I don’t want him benched; I trust our coaches, but I want to see Drew Barker for a few series during meaningful game time. UKChillfan October 8, 2015 at 11:34 am | Permalink | Reply 
I don’t want him bench, I want him to make the plays he SHOULD be able to make and avoid the 15 yard sacks. android guy October 8, 2015 at 1:02 pm | Permalink 
I want Barker to get some time too, but when every single game is this close, when will it happen? I wouldn’t want to lose a game just to get Barker some time. Lisa October 8, 2015 at 2:07 pm | Permalink 
I would like to see Towles benched. The games are close due to horrible passes & sacks. Barker needs playing time. Towles stays in because of the $$ his parents donate. We are lucky our receivers are flexible enough to catch so many passes on the ground Larry G Live October 8, 2015 at 2:15 pm | Permalink 
Lisa you are 100% correct Arm Chair Quarterbacks October 8, 2015 at 11:34 am | Permalink | Reply

I don’t want Towles benched, I want him to start making the routine throws that he needs to make in order for this offense to work. Right now we don’t know that Barker would be even as good as Towles, but until the offense starts clicking, we won’t get a comfortable enough lead to get him in there so we can find out. Bluemister October 8, 2015 at 11:46 am | Permalink | Reply 
Every time I see Kyper and his hair I wanna punch him inna face. Delk for 3 October 8, 2015 at 11:48 am | Permalink | Reply 
I told you all that Andrew Harrison wouldn’t make it in the NBA. KSR laughed at me. That proclamation is looking good at this point. I will tell you all right now with 100 percent certainty that Patrick Towles will never play in an NFL game. October 8, 2015 at 11:50 am | Permalink 
the NBA hasn’t even had a season since Andrew left UK Delk for 3 October 8, 2015 at 11:53 am | Permalink

So was Terrence Jones, and Patrick Patterson. Delk for 3 October 8, 2015 at 11:51 am | Permalink | Reply 
I don’t think Patrick Towles is a bad college quarterback. I honestly think he’s okay. That stated, I don’t think he’s so good that Drew Barker should never see the field. Patrick hasn’t played consistently strong enough to make the curiosity of what Drew can do go away. fatbrat October 8, 2015 at 12:03 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Something is wrong with this page! It wants to roll to the top at all times. Please fix! Bluecreeker October 8, 2015 at 12:08 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Delk, I would be willing to take that bet. 
Patrick Towles has every physical attribute need to be a successful NFL QB if he continues to improve mentally. 
Much of what you see as weakness has a lot to do with the offense they are trying to run. Let’s just say the 4th quarter of last weeks game is what the offense SHOULD look like. I saw a difference, did you? KT October 8, 2015 at 12:20 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Backup qb always popular. Towles is kind of becoming our football version of Andrew Harrison. He’s awesome but some people will never like him for whatever reason. He should be our starting qb. Barker would be getting reps if this team could win by more than one score but that’s not their style. We are a young talented team that can beat anyone on the schedule or lose as well(even to Charlotte). There will be a LOT of close games because offense is young and defense has overacheived to this point. Stay patient, we all see progress though. Still say 7-5 this year but defensive effort makes me believe we could sneak another win or 2 in there if we play well. Consistency on offense will continue to improve last half of season. I just hope our line stays healthy. CatsfaninFL October 8, 2015 at 1:14 pm | Permalink 
Injuries too. We’ve steered clear of them but with us being young any key player injury could seriously put us in trouble. Agree that 7-5 is quite doable…. Charlotte, Louisville, and Vandy (although Vandy at Vandy w/ that defense will not be the cake walk everyone is assuming) are our best shots for that but certainly not out of the realm to add in UT or Auburn given how they are playing. 
I also think with each win we have to be better at not letting it get to the young guys heads… every week will be a dogfight (as our 5 games decided by <9 has shown). jman3715 October 8, 2015 at 12:24 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Not sure about Towles but that dude’s hair is epic! Lorenzen's Gut October 8, 2015 at 12:52 pm | Permalink | Reply

Yet has a better record than Lamar Jackson, Reggie Bonnafon, and Kyle Bolin combined. 
Have a good day! DesignatedDrinker October 8, 2015 at 3:58 pm | Permalink 
People who dislike Towles have been purposefully misspelling it. It is juvenile and if these are the type of people who disapprove of him being the QB, then he definitely should be. But getting Barker a drive in the first half here and there through 5 games you would think would’ve been planned no matter the score. Towles starting and Barker getting some reps are what’s best for the program. Shannon Dawson leaving is also what’s best for the program. Nothing creative, nothing unpredictable. Should be 5-0, but ecstatic about 4-1. Memories October 8, 2015 at 1:06 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Number 1 underclass man QB Jared Goff, coached by Cal’s offensive coordinator Tony Franklin. 
Remember that guy? October 8, 2015 at 2:19 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Towles sucks and is a douchebag enough said. RockyMountainWildcat October 8, 2015 at 3:29 pm | Permalink 
And what’s your solution? That we play a kid who hasn’t taken a competitive snap yet instead of the guy who’s lead the team to a 4-1, very close to 5-0, record so far? Or are you just a troll? I’m guessing the latter… Derek Willis October 8, 2015 at 2:21 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Wish Stoops was my coach, so I could get playtime. Unfortunately I play under cal who plays the best players. RockyMountainWildcat October 8, 2015 at 3:28 pm | Permalink 
I’m confused. If you’re implying that Towles is the starter bc he’s an in state kid (like Willis), that point is kind of null and void, since Barker is also from Kentucky. Not trying to be obnoxious about it, you might be making a perfectly valid point, I just don’t know what it might be. Care to clarify a bit? JT October 8, 2015 at 3:49 pm | Permalink 
I think what the DW is implying, is Barker is better than Towles and should be playing. Its no secret that Patrick family donates a lot of money to the university and has a lot of influence. Plus you throw in Stoops who is still pissed off at Barker for off field stuff and that’s why patrck is playing. I tend to agree kybigblue October 8, 2015 at 4:04 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Didn’t Towles get outplayed by a redshirt freshmen in the UF game? Then he lead them to a big win over Ole Miss. Dieter October 8, 2015 at 4:33 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Yes, Stoops must be playing the inferior QB because his parents donate money, as opposed to the assuredly better, completely untested and unknown backup QB! It makes perfect sense, after all, for Stoops to jeopardize his job by knowingly electing to play the inferior player for a few Booster dollars… In Cal’s words, “you people are crazy.” If Towles is playing, it’s because he honestly believes their best chance to win is with him. He’s the professional. We are not. Dieter October 8, 2015 at 4:37 pm | Permalink 
“he” being Stoops and “him” being Towles. DB October 8, 2015 at 6:07 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Guys we are not the best football program out there, but Towles has brought us to a 4-1 record. We have a great chance of making a bowl. If it gets to the point where we may not make a bowl, then you can start calling for Towles head, but until then how about you all actually give him some support. Thisiswong October 8, 2015 at 6:44 pm | Permalink | Reply 
This article was written on June 25th(ish) Check it out.. 
Great reporting from KSR once again! CatsBaby October 8, 2015 at 6:52 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Doesnt matter. Drew gonna transfer anyways.. Watch n see. No way he sits behind Towles for another yr.. Andy October 8, 2015 at 9:43 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Does Towles have the physical tools to be a NFL QB- Yes but so did Josh Freeman. There are other aspects such as the mental aspect, accuracy and being able to read defenses. That’s what separates great QBS from back ups. Time will tell if he can be consistent in those areas. Until then the Jury is out. MattInTN October 9, 2015 at 4:44 am | Permalink | Reply 
You all are all absolutely insane. We’re 4-1!! Let me repeat, 4-1, 4-1, 4-1, 4-1. You seriously want to make a quarterback change when the only game we have lost is to a team that is much better than everyone predicted?? Get off Patrick’s back. The guy loves this program as much as any one of us reading this blog, and he’s playing good football. Anybody who things the backup that has NEVER TAKEN A COLLEGE SNAP is going to be better is completely off their rocker. If you would have told me Matt Roark would be our QB all year and we’d start 4-1, I’m taking it every single time! Just take a step back and look how far this program has come. Patrick is a guy that we can all get behind. He’s a Kentucky kid that bleeds blue and wants this program to be the best that it can be. We’re trying to make it to bowl games not win national titles. QB’S sit for 2-3 years at every major program. Drew will have his time and be great here, but Patrick is our guy right now and if you can’t get behind him then start cheering for that red team down the road!
